intro: Argyroderma patens, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Argyroderma patens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
